Detailed Description

This file contains implementation of test execution controller functionality.

Version:
0.1

Function Documentation

LOCAL void create_local_confdir (  ) 

Checks if the user configuration dir exists and creates it if not

int ec_abort_test_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Called by UI to stop test case execution.

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to dl_list_item containing selected test case
Returns:
result of operation: 0 if message was sent successfully, -1 in case of data or message queue error, -2 if case has already finished execution.

int ec_add_module ( TSChar *  mod_name,
DLList *  testcase_files,
test_module_id_t  id,
int  report 
)

Used to add test module to MIN framework at any time.

Parameters:
mod_name name of module to be added
testcase_files list containing names of test case files associated with the module.
id test module identifier
report flag stating if the module adding should be reported through MIN engine API plugin.
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
WARNING: function fails if there is problem with initializing data for module entity, possibly some memory problem, or if any of specified files does not exist. Information, if module was started successfully, (returned test cases) is not available. Indication of problems of that kind would be failure to start case from that module later.

LOCAL void ec_check_next_in_group ( int  group_id  ) 

Used to check if there is a test case with given group id in "selected_cases" list waiting to be executed and runs it if it is the case.

Parameters:
group_id - id og group of test cases in question.

void ec_cleanup (  ) 

Takes care of removal of all created objects, freeing memory and so on.

int ec_configure (  ) 

Reads config files in following order : MIN_CONF_DIR/min.conf, $HOME/.min/min.conf, ./min.conf. Settings with single value are overwritten, module and search paths are appended.

Returns:
0 on success, negative on error

int ec_debug_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Called to debug one test case. Prequisite: before calling this function, case should be put in "selected_cases" list, and that's from where argument should be taken.

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to item from "selected_cases" containing test case to be executed.
Returns:
-1 on error, otherwise 0

int ec_exec_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Execute one test case. Prequisite: before calling this function, case should be put in "selected_cases" list, and that's from where argument should be taken.

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to item from "selected_cases" containing test case to be executed.
Returns:
-1 on error, otherwise 0

LOCAL int ec_exec_case_temp ( DLListIterator  work_module_item  ) 

Start test case from temporarily instantianted module - process is slightly different than starting test case from ordinary module. "Temp" module has only one test case in list, so only that has to be passed to this function is module item.

Parameters:
work_module_item pointer to dllistitem containg "current" module.
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error

int ec_exec_test_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Called to execute one selected test case. It adds test case to selected test cases list, sets its status to ongoing and group id to 0, since it does not belong to group. Also, it adds new item to test case's results list.Function Sets module status to busy, then creates and sends MSG_EXE using data fetched from test case and module info

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to list itemwith case to be executed
Returns:
0 on ok, -1 on error.

LOCAL int ec_filter_it ( char *  title  ) 

Check test case title agains filters.

Parameters:
test case title string
Returns:
0 if the test case matches filter, 1 if not

LOCAL void ec_get_logger_settings ( MinSectionParser *  settings  ) 

Used to read logger settings. It was moved to separate function to keep functions shorter. It uses section andf item parser functionalities to write data to logger settings struct.

Parameters:
section fetched from config file

Initializes data for instantiated module.

Parameters:
work_module_item list item with module
proc_id PID of associated TMC process
Returns:
always 0

LOCAL int ec_message_dispatch ( MsgBuffer *  rcvd_message  ) 

Message dispatcher. Recognizes message type and calls appropriate handler. If received message is not of the type expected by engine, function logs error information.

Parameters:
message - pointer to received MsgBuffer
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message was handled, -1 otherwise.

LOCAL void * ec_message_listener ( void *  arg  ) 

Message listening thread. Contains while loop that checks messages in queue and calls ec_msg_dispatch to handle any message

Parameters:
arg some dummy pointer, to keep compiler from complaining

void ec_min_init ( char *  envp_[],
int  operation_mode 
)

Initializes all engine's global variables, creates message queues and threads. In case of problems during operations vital to test execution, function exits process - since if any of those operations fail - MIN will not be able to work anyway

Parameters:
completecallbk pointer to function called when test case completes
printcallbk pointer to function called when test case tries to print output
extifsendcallbk pointer to function sending external controller messages
envp pointer to enviroment settings var
operation_mode - describes what is the operation mode of min instance - 0 means console interface, 1 - external controller interface.

LOCAL int ec_msg_event_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_EVENT message.

Parameters:
message - pointer to MsgBuffer containing message
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message was handled, -1 otherwise

LOCAL int ec_msg_ko_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_KO message, which means that some trouble occured on tmc's side. Hadling depends on state of module: if it's TEST_MODULE_INITIALIZED, it means that test case extraction is impossible. Module will be removed from "instantiated" list and terminated.Problems will be logged.

Parameters:
message - pointer to MsgBuffer containing message
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.

int ec_msg_ms_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

return value for the whole prog.

Handler for ipc external controller message, used in master/slave scenarios (hence _ms_); since those in turn have several "subtypes", function reads type and calls apropriate handlers.

Parameters:
message MsgBUffer containing received IPC message
Returns:
result of the operation

LOCAL int ec_msg_ok_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_OK. As it is first message sent by module, function set's module status to TC_SENDING, initilaizes test cases list for module and sends message MSG_GTC

Parameters:
message pointer to MsgBuffer structure containing message
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message handling was succesful, -1 otherwise

LOCAL int ec_msg_ret_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_RET with test case results

Parameters:
message - pointer to MsgBuffer containing message
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.

LOCAL int ec_msg_run_id_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_RUN_ID message.

Parameters:
message - pointer to MsgBuffer containing message
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message was handled, -1 otherwise

int ec_msg_sndrcv_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for sendreceive ipc message from slave

LOCAL int ec_msg_tcd_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_TCD message. Creates new test_case_s structure and inserts it into appropriate module's case list.

Parameters:
message - pointer to MsgBuffer containing message
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message was handled, -1 otherwise

LOCAL int ec_msg_usr_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for MSG_USR message. This message is used to pass "printouts" from test case to user. Handler will write received data to apropriate place in test result's printouts list according to priority of printout. Accessing proper test case/result data will be done in a way similar to MSG_RET handler.

Parameters:
message pointer to MsgBuffer containing read message
Returns:
result of message handling, 0 if message was handled, -1 otherwise.

int ec_pause_test_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Called by UI to pause execution of selected test case.

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to dl_list_item containig selected test case.
Returns:
result of operation :0 if message was sent successfully, -1 in case of data or message queue error, -2 if case is already paused, -3 if case is not running

Looks for files in directory /etc/min.d and tries to find module configurations from them

int ec_resume_test_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Called by UI to resume execution of previously paused case:

Parameters:
work_case_item pointer to dl_list_item containing selected test case
Returns:
: result of operation: 0 if message was sent successfully, -1 in case of data or message queue error, -2 if case was not paused, -3 if case is not running (not started or already finished).

Called by user to execute test cases simultaneouslu.

Called by user to execute a sequence of test cases

work_cases_list list of test cases to be executed - user has to build list of test cases by himself.

int ec_search_lib ( char *  mod_name  ) 

Searches defined library search paths for library with given name

Parameters:
mod_name name of file to be found
Returns:
position of correct path on search paths list, or -1 if file is not found.

DLListIterator ec_select_case ( DLListIterator  work_case_item,
int  group_id 
)

Select test case for execution - passed test case is copied, and then copied case is added to "selected" list. As this function modifies "selected" list, code that calls it should first lock "tec_mutex_", and unlock it after executing the function.

Parameters:
work_case_item DLList item containing selected case
group_id id of group to which case belongs
Returns:
item from "selected cases" list

LOCAL void ec_settings_send (  ) 

Create shared memory segment and write settings to it, so that they can be used by other processes (TMCs). Currently sent settings are: logger's settings placed in apropriate structure, and search paths (if there are any search paths defined), concatenated into one NULL-terminated string, separated by ":" character. If program fails to createshared memory segment, it will exit the application.

LOCAL int ec_start_module_temp ( DLListIterator  work_case_item  ) 

Used for temporary module instantiation and test case execution, used when there is a need to execute two test cases from the same module in parallel.

Parameters:
work_case_item DLListItem containing test case to be executed
Returns:
0 on success -1 on error

int ec_start_modules (  ) 

Instantiates all modules from available modules list.

Returns:
number of started modules

LOCAL pid_t ec_start_tmc ( DLListIterator  work_module_item  ) 

Test module controller process starting. In case of failure to start tmc, information will be logged.

Parameters:
work_module_item item from available modules list
Returns:
pid of newly created process, or -1 in case of failure

Removes the Event System from the engine. Delete lists of indication and state events.
